title: Losing LP & ranks when players disconnect shouldn't reflect our rankings and should be fixed by RIOT

embed.description: Every game is a story; visit the new League of Legends match history to check out how this one ends and share your own!

body:
Hi all!

This is my first post on this forum, but not the first I've written about an online game so hopefully my thoughts and feedback are considered worthwhile for those who play League of Legends.

You can read a lot more below, but mostly my point is that if someone is AFK or disconnected that that game should not count as a loss to me or my other teammates. When 30% of my promo games had someone on my team either go AFK or disconnect why should I be punished by having that game count as a loss and subsequently put in the lower rankings. Other players can be extremely lucky and have 10 reasonable games in ranked and end up in higher tiers etc. and yet others are left with people who have internet connections made from string between two tin cans and drag their team mates down into the lowest ranks.

This game link I believe showed that despite playing quite well and managing to get a few kills, that our team mate (Talon) being disconnected ultimately ruined our chances of winning and as such I don't think I should be demoted to Bronze II for that poor excuse for a game; 

http://matchhistory.oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/#match-details/OC1/87459219/201021950?tab=overview

A few games earlier (in normals) our team still lost, but I played fairly well, carrying the team (including selling my boots for more damage in a base defense and warding more than any of my other team mates). I can deal with losing because my team sucks or me not being good enough to carry the game to victory, but I am putting this link up just to point out that I am still fairly good at the game and not just another person claiming that I should be in "Challenger". I fully understand that this is a ranked team game and as such losing is losing, but at least in this game we had 5 players and stood some chance of winning the game;

http://matchhistory.oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/#match-details/OC1/87453205/201021950?tab=overview

What got me into ranked in the first place was that I like a challenge. I also had a goal. My friend was in Silver and said to me that if I could get into SIlver that he would Duo with me. When I got into Bronze 1 I was frustrated especially because I knew just how many games I would have to win just to get to Silver 5. Given the number of AFK'ers, Disconnections and feeders I am starting to understand the whole Bronze ELO hell thing people keep going on about.

This issue I want and in a few ways need to raise is that when playing ranked games having a player on your team disconnect, go AFK or worse, deliberately feed are some of the worst experiences you can have. The consequences of someone losing the game for the team are that they will most likely have their rankings and their match history reflect poorly on even those that played out of their minds trying to scrape a win in a 4v5 game and reflects poorly on the ranking system itself and should be something that RIOT actively addresses.

I used to play a lot of support. Lulu was one of my favourites and the new champ Bard was one that really got me into playing a good warding, roaming support, but when I had a bad losing streak in ranked due in some parts to my mistakes in game (i certainly won't be claiming to be a gold+ player) and partly due to my ADC's being quite poor and or other lanes feeding I decided to push my limits and went back to normals and started playing Jinx ADC, Wukong Top and Annie Mid to get used to playing in a different roles and different champs to see if I could carry a game or see if I was in need of a lot more practice.

When I started to play ranked I lost I think 7 out of 10 games in the promos. One game was awful on my part as a Nautilus jungler and I failed seriously in that game, but in my other games I thought I played pretty well and once I won my first game as LuLu I decided to keep playing her as support. My luck ran out pretty quickly though when lanes fed or worse someone disconnected or went AFK and when my ADC was just awful I started considering changing champs/roles right then even in game, but stuck it out and when I got my rank, Bronze 1 I was pretty annoyed. I'm not sure if I could see video of my games, but if I could have I felt that our losses were not largely attributable to me. Sure I could have tried by swapping lanes and going full Attack Speed/Ability Power LuLu and carry our team out of defeat, but my experience has been that when the support takes over or the toxicity in game chat goes up you are even more likely to lose and to be honest I wasn't confident I could do that and had committed my gold and masteries to support and by the time I was thinking about changing it was too late anyway and I was too far behind in gold and experience to make the difference anyway.

After playing quite a few normal and custom games as Jinx and Annie I felt quite confident that I could win a game as an AD/AP carry in ranked. I was wrong.

The game hadn't even really started and we all knew our Mid laner Talon was not going to be there. We tried anyway and to our credit we held up OK given the 4v5 game. Then Talon reconnected. Praise the Sun! I thought OK stay positive, we can do this. No sooner did Talon walk into mid lane he was swiftly killed by Lux. Great. GG. He then disconnected again. Then came back and tried to support. Nope. Completely useless. He then quit and we lost and I was demoted to Bronze 2 and decided to write this post.

Good luck in your games and hopefully I'll be in Silver some time this century.

GGWP

replies.body: so, whenever we want to not lose lp we just afk?
That's not what he said. He said players should not be punished for _other_ players going AFK or disconnecting. There's a difference.

No that would reward bad behaviour. Something to consider would be having AFK'ers lose more LP whilst the others in the team maintain their LP when a team mate goes AFK or disconnects.

Not sure how hard this would be to implement, but would help to reduce the consequences  for the rest of the team when they are unlucky enough to have one person who throws a game by leaving.

Not sure it would be as easy to deal with intentional feeders, but Tha is why I suggest a fix to AFK'ers and disconnecters. I figure the system would be able to automatically register if someone is standing at the fountain for most of the game or not being in game at all.

Thanks for asking for clarification. The title wouldn't quite fit the point I wanted to make

I'm in silver currently but my fight and successful journey to gold last season was extremely hard with afker's. Winning 2 and losing 2 in my series for gold only to have the 5th game a afk mid. I agree something should be done but would be hard to accomplish I think on a whole the easiest thing to implement would be if you afk from ranked 3 times in a month your banned for 2 months from playing ranked. that would allow for some unexpected afk like emergencies or computer/network failure.

That's my thought

Add that to the list of punishments that should be considered.

I just disconnected from a game just then (not entirely sure why, but reset my modem and computer) and it counted as me leaving a game.

The only punishment I got was to have a few LP taken for the loss (the game was lost very early on anyway due to feeders) and an extended queue time for duo's and team games. Not really a hefty punishment

Not being a douche, when it became clear there was something wrong with my connection I stopped trying to enter games and ruin them for everyone else

I was just logging into the forums to post something very similar to this! Glad you have started the ball rolling...

Want to re-iterate some of your points and add some more **solutions**

* If you join a game and someone afks or disconnects you shouldn't lose I.P (or at least as much)
*If someone disconnects or afks pause the game for up to 5 minutes (unless everyone agrees to continue by clicking a 'continue anyway' button)
* If someone leaves the game and is away for more than 5 minutes have a queue option for replacements, whereby someone in the queue has the option to join the game with the same gold/items and pick up from where the other play left off (reward this by ensuring if replacements are part of a losing team they have less point loss - or bonus points for turning it round)
* Continue to punish frequent afkers/leavers but possibly increase the punishment for each new incidence 
* Reward consistently good behavior with skins (i.e 'Keeper of the Code' or 'Captain Friendly' skins), riot points or i.p 
* Employee riot 'Advocacy Watchers' - riot employees (or current members of the community who consistently uphold the summoners code or advocate team work/good behaviour) to spectate games (start with all bronze games), watch gameplay, team work, instances of afk/leave, toxicity etc' who can vote for positive behaviour, reward it and even down vote negative behaviour

I have significant experience in customer advocacy and building positive cultures (feel free to contact me directly for more info)

Currently the game punishes the whole team for 1 player leaving/afk. 
This produces toxicity in the lower levels of Bronze

I doubt RIOT even cares, i mean how long have we waited for tribunal?
When people get fed up with the toxicity and stop paying, then RIOT will take actions. Money talks etc.

You'd think something this simple to fix would help encourage more players and hence more revenue.

It's a shame it takes people leaving a game for someone to recognize that maybe they should address these issues.

Hell it might also encourage a better game experience overall and not just in ranked.

As it stands I can just keep practicing and maybe this might be a good time to build a team of 5 people I know won't leave for no reason
